They tried every trick in the book, and yet the game is still dying. It has been on its deathbed for the longest time, but it really is just getting sad now. Don't give them your money btw, we don't negotiate with terrorists.

OVERWATCH AND OVERWATCH 2 ARE NOT THE SAME GAME. THEY ARE TWO DIFFERENT GAMES MADE BY TWO DIFFERENT DEVELOPMENT TEAMS THAT SHARE THE SAME NAME "TEAM 4".

THE GAME HAS BEEN "BALANCED" INTO OBLIVION, AND THE ONLY FEATURE THAT THEY CARE ABOUT MAINTAINING IS THEIR SHOP.

if anyone does read this in the sea of negative reviews from bots

ill leave my honest, since 2016 i always found overwatch as a game i enjoyed in my heart, many other games like team fortress 2, destiny, hollowknight, and a couple of others followed along

but ive seen no other game accomplish a design like overwatch, the game at its core despite facing many issues mainly from blizzard as of currently, is still fun and enjoyable, many of the characters have multiple kits suited for your style, maps and artstyle is absolutely fantastical, and even still manages to hold up compared to other games of the market

last to say it doesnt say it doesnt have negatives, it has many negatives, the cut of PVE content was heartbreaking but it was expected, many of microtransactions are overpriced and made to lure you into buying, and earning premium currency is a tedious and unrewarding grind, and the challenge system can be reworked or overhauled

and whoever says that games like team fortress 2 did better is full of mud because how valve treated TF2 and used it to create the first loot boxes and gambling mechanics and economy will always be worse than overwatch's microtransactions, at least you get what you pay for, not have high chances of being scammed for overpricing or even having your inventory items stolen, and the state of that game as well is a whole other story

but enough my rants on that, i recommend the game just to tinker around and see if it suites your taste, and if it doesnt no problem, at least you gave it a shot, to those who've been playing for a long time like me whos been playing since 2016, you can always take breaks like i would, its better to take a break on a game you like than burn yourself out on it making it a chore and hassle than something you like to invest your hours and have fun on.

I still like this game more than other shooters on the market right now. I'm happy I can now log the amount of hours I'm suffering through this game. In all seriousness, the team has a lot to do to make sure this game doesn't collapse. A beautiful game with a fantastic universe and lovely characters marred by corporate shenanigans.
This game deserves better, and so does the playerbase. May Microsoft get this game back to it's former glory. I can't stop playing this game.
